com.stremebase.dal

Interface Cursor

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Cursor.BasicCursor, Cursor.StreamCursor, Cursor.TopNCursor

    public interface Cursor
    Cursor is the result of a database query
    Author:
    olli

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Cursor.BasicCursor
      The normal not-bigData -cursor, used when search result fits into main memory
      static class  Cursor.StreamCursor
      The big data cursor that will not store search results and therefore allows only forward iteration and does not support sorting
      static class  Cursor.TopNCursor
      The big data cursor that supports sorting by keeping only Top (according to sortOrder) N (defined by limit) search results

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static ExpandingArray buffer 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int count()
      The count of search results
      boolean first()
      Moves the cursor to first result
      long get()
      Gets the search result at the current cursor position
      long get(int position)
      Gets the search result at the given position (without moving cursor)
      static Cursor getCursor(boolean bigData, LongStream stream, Collection<LongPredicate> filters, SortOrder sortOrder, int limit)
      Returns the right kind of cursor for a search result
      LongStream getResult()
      The search result as a stream.
      boolean last()
      Moves the cursor to last result
      void moveTo(int position, boolean changeDirection)
      Moves the cursor to given position
      boolean next()
      Moves the cursor to next result, which is depending on direction either previous or following result
      void setDirection(boolean forward)
      Sets whether next() retrieves previous (towards first) or following (towards last) key
      void sort(SortOrder sortOrder)
      Sorts the search result

    • Field Detail

      • buffer

        static final ExpandingArray buffer

    • Method Detail

      • setDirection

        void setDirection(boolean forward)
        Sets whether next() retrieves previous (towards first) or following (towards last) key
        Parameters:
        forward - the direction

      • first

        boolean first()
        Moves the cursor to first result
        Returns:
        false, if there are no query results

      • last

        boolean last()
        Moves the cursor to last result
        Returns:
        false, if there are no query results

      • next

        boolean next()
        Moves the cursor to next result, which is depending on direction either previous or following result
        Returns:
        false, if there is no next result

      • moveTo

        void moveTo(int position,
            boolean changeDirection)
        Moves the cursor to given position
        Parameters:
        position - the position
        changeDirection - if true, direction is changed if move is towards new direction

      • count

        int count()
        The count of search results
        Returns:
        the number

      • get

        long get()
        Gets the search result at the current cursor position
        Returns:
        the current result

      • get

        long get(int position)
        Gets the search result at the given position (without moving cursor)
        Parameters:
        position - the position
        Returns:
        the search result

      • sort

        void sort(SortOrder sortOrder)
        Sorts the search result
        Parameters:
        sortOrder - the sort criteria

      • getResult

        LongStream getResult()
        The search result as a stream. Direction is always forwards.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getCursor

        static Cursor getCursor(boolean bigData,
                        LongStream stream,
                        Collection<LongPredicate> filters,
                        SortOrder sortOrder,
                        int limit)
        Returns the right kind of cursor for a search result
        Parameters:
        bigData - If true, the whole search result is not read into main memory
        stream - The search result stream
        filters - How the stream is filtered
        sortOrder - How the stream is sorted
        limit - Maximum number of search results to retrieve. Note that bigData must be limited to Top N if it is to be sorted.
        Returns:
        the appropriate cursor
